briefdescription.para: SCIP data structure

detaileddescription.para: includes the pip file reader into SCIP

briefdescription.para: SCIP data structure
the file reader itself
full path and name of file to read, or NULL if stdin should be used
pointer to store the result of the file reading call

memberdef.argsstring: (SCIP *scip, FILE *file, const char *name, SCIP_Bool transformed, SCIP_OBJSENSE objsense, SCIP_Real objscale, SCIP_Real objoffset, SCIP_VAR **vars, int nvars, int nbinvars, int nintvars, int nimplvars, int ncontvars, SCIP_CONS **conss, int nconss, SCIP_RESULT *result)
memberdef.name: SCIPwritePip

briefdescription.para: SCIP data structure
output file, or NULL if standard output should be used
problem name
TRUE iff problem is the transformed problem
objective sense
scalar applied to objective function; external objective value is extobj = objsense * objscale * (intobj + objoffset)
objective offset from bound shifting and fixing
array with active variables ordered binary, integer, implicit, continuous
number of active variables in the problem
number of binary variables
number of general integer variables
number of implicit integer variables
number of continuous variables
array with constraints of the problem
number of constraints in the problem
pointer to store the result of the file writing call
file reader for polynomial mixed-integer programs in PIP format

detaileddescription.para: Stefan Vigerske This reader allows to parse and write PIP files with linear and polynomial constraints and objective. For writing, linear (general and specialized), quadratic, and "and" constraints are supported. Also abspower, bivariate, and nonlinear constraints may be written, if they are representable as polynomials.
The PIP format is similar to the LP format and defined at http://polip.zib.de/pipformat.php .
